title.narrative: Eco Friendly Agriculture with market linkages to marginalised farmers

description.narrative: ADISIL was focussing on B2B model and were selling the vegetables through SAAL digital platform to major organic outlets in metro cities. B2C model to generate more demands and income generation to customers. Organic certification to give licence to farmers to sell organic vegetables and will enhance the price. Need assessment with consumers will enable ADISIL to include the vegetables as per the consumer need for cultivation. Agripreneurs to link with consumer forum will also help in promoting awareness on organic vegetables and improved sales. The digital webstore will help the farmers to see on-line and to receive the money directly in their bankaccount.

To improve the Revenue for the Agripreneurs and Organic Farmers, ADISIL to work on organic certification to 100 farmers. This could not be taken up last year due to pandemic. 4 farmers have been formed as registered as society to and to support in processing and collection of key documents. Soil & water testing of these farmers with frequent inspection to be conducted before the visit of Tamil Nadu Organic Certification department. This year 1200 tribal and Dalit farmers to be included for registration from Bodi, Periyakulam, Anaimalai and Pollachi areas and three groups to be formed. These group to be registered as society to access government entitlements. ADISIL to focus on B2C concept and need assessment to be conducted. Agripreneurs to link with consumer forums and sales and marketing to be linked with SAAL Digital platform. Webstore to be created to link farmers with consumers directly to increase income generation and to promote sustainability.
